flights. A study in the UK shows that
not getting the full dose of covid-19 vaccine or
not getting a booster dose increases the number of
deaths and hospitalizations. The study was
conducted.  for the entire UK population of
about 67 million people and published
in the Laneet Medical Journal,
more than 90% of the UK population over 12 years old
have received at least one dose of
covid-19 vaccine by January 2022.
However, by the summer of the same year, up to 44
parts of the UK population did not receive the recommended number of doses
or booster doses, leading to
more than 7,000 hospitalizations and deaths
out of a total of 40,400 severe cases from June
to September
2022.  According to data, groups of men,
young people, people of color and people from
disadvantaged backgrounds tend to not get enough
doses of the vaccine. In addition, people over
75 years old who do not get enough doses of the vaccine are twice as likely to have
severe Covid-19.  times compared to
people of the same age who were fully vaccinated and
repeated the dose. The team of experts who
conducted the study believe that because of the current
vaccine coverage rate during the
covid-19 pandemic, it can contribute to reducing the number of
cases.
